column1: These cells produce melanin, the substance that gives skin its color.

Causes of hyperpigmentation include: - Skin inflammation (post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation) - Use of certain drugs (such as minocycline and birth control pills) - Endocrine diseases such as Addison disease - Hemochromatosis (iron overload) - Sun exposure - Pregnancy Causes of hypopigmentation include: - Skin inflammation - Certain fungal infections (such as tinea versicolor) - Pityriasis alba - Vitiligo - Certain medicines - Skin condition called idiopathic guttate hyomelanosis
